name: Embassy Suites Riverwalk

reviews.text: Stayed here as an off-site hotel at a conference I recently attended. The price was great, and the square footage of the room was really generous. Also, the layout of these suites was fantastic -- allowed for a lot of privacy between people sharing the same room.
reviews.title: Clean, fresh, new - and much better than other hotels in the immediate area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was tremendously clean and sleep was very easy on this bedding.
reviews.title: San Antonio Riverwalk Embassy

reviews.text: Living room couch was kind of weird and not particularly comfortable, but it was new. And, it was a pull-out, which could be good for larger groups traveling together.
reviews.title: Wonderful property - Great location

reviews.text: Very spacious, clean, and reasonably-priced! Also, while not overlooking the Riverwalk, it is only 2 blocks away.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the worst hotel breakfast buffets I've had, and I've had many bad ones.
reviews.title: Not one complaint here!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a family three night get away. We have 4 kids ages 9-14 and "The Big E" as we call it is about the only hotel we find where we can all "fit" without having to purchase the second room. So we frequent them as often as we can and the complimentary cooked breakfast is a huge plus as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel nice family get away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late on a Friday evening or early Saturday morning about 1:00. The hotel only offers valet parking for $27 per night which I had read previously no surprise. There is a parking lot across the street that is $20 but no security. We did valet, we had lots of luggage with a large family so I asked for a cart and he said he couldn't just send a cart with us he would have to go up as well but didn't really seem as though he wanted to so we carried it all.
reviews.title: Happy 4th of July

reviews.text: Our room was beautiful!! Nicer than most Big E's we have stayed in!  Room was very cool, and stayed that way our entire stay, which is great in early July in Texas. Beds were very comfortable. We had a room with a view of the riverwalk and the pool. We were walking distance of the main part of the riverwalk, and the Alamo.
reviews.title: Managers were amazing food and beverage staff were rude!

reviews.text: Breakfast the following morning was packed. My husband actually had to stand to eat, which I do understand it was July 4th weekend. The food itself and selection we didn't feel was as good as what we are accustomed to with the Embassy but still good and plenty of it. The second morning it wasn't near as crowded could have been that we went much earlier. We didn't eat with them the last morning.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: We didn't take advantage of the evening reception.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is shiny, new, & beautiful. It is at the far end of the Riverwalk which means it is quiet, but it also means that it is a rather long hike to the middle of the action. But in the heat of July, the walk probably felt a bit longer than it actually was.
reviews.title: Beautiful Lobby-Quiet Location

reviews.text: The staff was helpful and friendly, but there was one big problem: Breakfast. The service was haphazard. They were consistently out of glasses, silverware, milk, juice, etc. Perhaps it was a busy weekend and they were not used to so many diners, but it didn't seem overly crowded. (The restaurant rating is based on the breakfast service, not the steakhouse.)
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Also, the rooms seemed smaller than most Embassy Suites and the pool was tiny, so don't expect a leisurely soak after a day in the hot, Texas sun.
reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Wow, a hotel with a suite in the riverwalk for a reasonable price!!! Great place to visit SA with family, parking is pricey but got no other convenient choice at the riverwalk. The hotel is brand new so everything is pristine. Staff is great. Will come back for sure.
reviews.title: Great Place!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here during a hot weekend in July. The hotel is beautiful, rooms spacious, and very COLD with the a/c way down. Beds the most comfy I have ever had in a hotel. We loved the breakfast every morning, and participted in the 2 hours cocktail hour every evening before having dinner on the riverwalk.
reviews.title: Most satisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel at the quiet end of the riverwalk, but still a very easy five minute walk to the action! They have a great breakfast offering anything you can imagine - even made to order omelets. The evening reception left a little to be desired, but breakfast more than made up for that. Definitely recommend this hotel as a place to stay on the riverwak.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This is a great hotel. We spent 7 nights there. It's a newer property and is on the Riverwalk, about 5-8 minutes walk from the center of the Riverwalk activity and restaurants. As with all Embassy Suites, they have an awesome breakfast and a great 2 hour free cocktail party with some appetizers. We are members of Hilton HHonors and got upgraded to the top floor (17th) with a Riverwalk view. The ones facing the Riverwalk have small balconies with a chair. The room was excellent with very comfortable beds, two closets, spacious bathroom, refrigerator, sink, coffeemaker and microwave. Their was a couch and separate deck. You can connect to the internet via a cable. I believe they had wifi in the lobby.
reviews.title: Extremely Nice Hotel & Staff

reviews.text: The only drawbacks were: cost per night before all of the taxes was $ 186.00, parking was $ 27.00 per night valet (they did have a parking lot across the street for $ 20.00 per day), and internet was $ 10.00 per day. Also, we could not get the room as cool as we wanted. It was comfortable, but couldn't get the temperature lower than 74-75 degrees.
reviews.title: They made a difference, I am sold!

reviews.text: I had the untimely experience of getting stuck in San Antonio with my spouse after a business trip, San Antonio not being the first place that comes to mind when spending time with a spouse for me, but I have to say that we took a chance on this brand new property and had the most incredible time.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A hotel stay is made of a few key elements and here is my opinion on them for this property:
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel! Great location, beautiful rooms, and friendly staff!

aka: Embassy Suites Riverwalk Hotel San Antonio
description: The Embassy Suites San Antonio Riverwalk – Downtown hotel is set on the banks of the San Antonio River in the vibrant heart of San Antonio, Texas. Grab a bargain at the Mexican Market or discover the rides and attractions of Six Flags® Fiesta Texas or SeaWorld® San Antonio. All guest suites at this beautiful San Antonio Riverwalk hotel offer more space and flexibility, with separate sleeping and living areas, and a wide range of thoughtful amenities. Relax with the two flat screen 32-inch TVs, or keep up with work at the flexible work space.
